08d0d4295c.gt:
Wash the sweet potato well and use a paper towel to dry.
Heat the oil.
Cut the parts of the potato that you are going to fry into long strips.
If you aren't going to be washing in water, you should fry it quickly or it'll change color.
Fry slowly at about 170C for a nice color.
Sandwich between paper towels to remove the oil, shake some salt over all of them.
Repeat steps 2 - 4.
08d0d4295c.pred:
To cook Deep-Fried Salty Sweet Potato Sticks, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oil in a large frying pan or deep fryer to a temperature of 350°F (175°C).
2. Peel and chop the sweet potato into evenly sized sticks, about 1-inch (2.5 cm) in length.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the salt and any desired seasonings, such as paprika, cayenne pepper, or garlic powder.
4. Dip each sweet potato stick into the seasoned salt mixture, ensuring that it is evenly coated.
5. Carefully place the seasoned sweet potato sticks into the hot oil in the frying pan or deep fryer, ensuring that they are not overcrowded.
6. Fry the sticks for about 5-7 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy on all sides.
7. Remove the fried sticks from the oil using a slotted spoon or tongs, and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain any excess oil.
8. Serve the Deep-Fried Salty Sweet Potato Sticks immediately, as they will become soggy if left in the oil for too long.

These steps will result in a delicious and crispy Deep-Fried Salty Sweet Potato Stick dish, perfect for a snack or appetizer.

874ce55813.gt:
Put all marinade ingrediantsin a large ziplock bag.
Mix well.
Add chicken breasts.
For a mild flavour, leave for 30 minutes.
For more intensity, leave up to 4 hours but no longer.
Heat up grill to medium high.
Cook breasts, with lid closed for about 7 (7 1/2) minutes per side.
874ce55813.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped dill, olive oil, minced garlic, crushed fennel seed, and salt and pepper to taste.
3. Add the chicken breasts to the marinade, ensuring they are evenly coated. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
4. Remove the chicken from the marinade and pat it dry with paper towels.
5. Heat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
6. Place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
7. Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
8. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
9. Serve the chicken with the marinade, lemon wedges, and a side of your choice.

[/INST]

163b52a061.gt:
Cut broccoli and cauliflower into smaller pieces.
Heat water in a large wok to boiling and add broccoli and cauliflower.
Let sit for 2-3 minutes, then remove from wok, drain and rinse with cold water.
In same wok, heat 1-2 T oil on high.
Add ginger, garlic, carrot, and green onion.
Cook until garlic starts to turn brown.
Be careful not to overcook!
Add broccoli and cauliflower and stir.
Add sauce, stir, and let simmer for several minutes.
Serve immediately!
163b52a061.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the broccoli florets, cauliflower, carrot, and garlic together.
3. Heat a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until it is soft and translucent.
4. Add the broccoli, cauliflower, carrot, and garlic mixture to the skillet or wok. Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
5. Add the oyster sauce, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, and red pepper flakes to the skillet or wok. Stir to combine.
6. Season the mixture with salt to taste.
7. Transfer the stir fry to a serving dish and serve immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

283c2400cb.gt:
Transfer cream to bowl of 5-quart electric stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment.
Tightly cover top of bowl and mixer with plastic wrap.
Beat cream at moderately high speed until it holds soft peaks, 10 to 12 minutes.
Increase speed to high and beat until mixture separates into thick, pale-yellow butter and thin, liquid buttermilk, about 5 minutes more.
Strain mixture through colander into large bowl.
Using hands, vigorously knead butter in colander, squeezing out remaining buttermilk, until dense and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Transfer butter to large bowl, reserving buttermilk.
Using hands, knead salt into butter.
Roll into logs and wrap in plastic wrap or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate.
(Butter will keep up to 1 week refrigerated or 1 month frozen.)
Strain buttermilk through fine-mesh sieve, then cover and refrigerate up to 1 week.
283c2400cb.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 6 cups of heavy cream and 1/4 teaspoon of fine sea salt.
2. Using a stand mixer, beat the cream on medium speed until it reaches a soft peak stage, about 3-5 minutes.
3. Slowly add the buttermilk, beating until the mixture reaches the desired consistency. This may take a few minutes, depending on the desired thickness.
4. If the mixture is too thick, you can add a bit more buttermilk to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Once the desired consistency is reached, transfer the mixture to a clean, dry container and store in the refrigerator for at least 24 hours before using.
6. After 24 hours, the butter will have solidified and become easier to handle. You can then scoop it out and use it as needed.

[/INST]

This recipe for homemade butter and buttermilk is simple yet effective, allowing you to control the quality and taste of the ingredients. The stand mixer is essential for achieving the right consistency and texture, as it provides the necessary power and speed to whip the cream and buttermilk into a smooth and creamy mixture. The 24-hour refrigeration period ensures that the butter has time to solidify and become easier to handle, making it a convenient and delicious addition to your kitchen.

217d8f645b.gt:
Preheat oven to 375F degrees.
Put a sheet of tinfoil on a cookie sheet.
Spray cookie sheet with lite olive oil or other veggie oil.
In a small bowl combine; onion flakes,oregano, garlic, paprika, salt& pepper, mix well.
Brush cut sides of the potato wedges with olive oil and sprinkle with the spice mixture.
Place potato pieces cut side down on the prepared cookie sheet.
Bake until underside are golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Gently turn the wedges so the other side is on the cookie sheet.
Bake for another 15-20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender and golden.
Serve while they ar piping hot.
217d8f645b.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with the onion flakes, oregano, garlic, paprika, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the potatoes out on a baking sheet or a large roasting pan.
4. Drizzle the olive oil over the potatoes, making sure to coat them evenly.
5. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are golden brown and tender.
6. Carefully remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Fried Potatoes Without the Fry as a healthier alternative to traditional fried potatoes.

093fcaf5a6.gt:
Start by heating a medium-sized pot (you will cook everything in this pot) on medium heat, then add the oil.
Once oil comes to temperature, add cubed pork belly.
Cook pork belly, turning as it cooks, until all sides are browned.
Once pork is browned, add onions, garlic, and ginger.
Give a good stir, and continue to cook for about 3 minutes or so.
Add the shrimp paste.
Turn on your vent on high as this stuff has some funk (good funk), and continue to stir.
Toss in chilies, stir again, then add coconut milk.
Bring to a simmer and cook for about 1 hour, on low, stirring along the way.
Before serving, taste and season with salt or pepper.
Now you are ready to dig in.
I like to serve with a small bowl of rice to the side, along with a soup bowl of the Bicol Express.
This dish is rich, creamy, spicy, funky, and overall totally comforting and right up my alley.
093fcaf5a6.pred:
1. In a large skillet or wok, heat the canola oil over medium heat. Add the pork cubes and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.

2. In the same skillet, add the sliced onion and minced garlic. Cook until the onion is softened, about 2-3 minutes.

Immediately invert onto plate.
Combine powdered sugar, cinnamon and water, stir well.
Drizzle over hot bread.

3In large bowl, beat cake mix, margarita mix, water, oil, egg whites and 3 tsp zest with electric mixer on low speed 30 seconds, then on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.

Store loosely covered in refrigerator.

Cook the beets in boiling salted water until tender, 25 to 35 minutes.
Drain, slip off the skins under cold running water, and cut away the root ends and stalks.
Coarsely grate the beets, using the shredding disk of a food processor or the large holes of a hand grater (latex gloves are recommended for the latter or you'll look like an axe murderer!
).
Combine the garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add the beets and yogurt and blend well.
Taste and add a pinch of sugar if desired.
Transfer to a serving dish, cover and refrigerate until well chilled, about 1 hour.
Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint just before serving.

12. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
13. Garnish the dish with a sprig of fresh mint and serve immediately.

495600903f.gt:
Heat oven to 300 degrees F.
Place 2-L casserole dish in oven to warm.
Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat.
Add onions and garlic; cook 2 to 3 min.
or until crisp-tender, stirring frequently.
Add rice; cook and stir 2 min.
Stir in wine; cook and stir 1 min.
or until absorbed.
Add chicken and broth; stir.
Bring just to boil.
Spoon into warmed casserole dish; cover.
Bake 30 min.
or until rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed.
Add spinach; stir just until wilted.
Add cheese; stir until melted.

This delicious Oven-Baked Chicken and Spinach Risotto is a satisfying and comforting meal that can be enjoyed with friends and family.

3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced yellow onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Add the curry powder and garam masala to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for another minute.
5. Add the pumpkin puree, chicken broth, and heavy cream to the skillet. Stir to combine.
6. Season the mixture with kosher salt, and add the green onions. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Once the sauce has thickened slightly, add the cooked pasta to the skillet. Stir to combine, and cook for a few minutes until the pasta is heated through.
8. Remove the skillet from the heat, and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
9. Serve the Pumpkin Curry Penne over a bed of rice, and enjoy your delicious Pumpkin Curry Penne dish!

78d578c5e4.gt:
heat oven to 400, using a oven safe bowl, it can be a casserole dish to bake ur dip in.
it just needs to bake for 13 minutes
in a bowl put all ingredients, except 1 tablespoon of almonds, reserved till later.
mix well together, put in oven safe dish.
now sprinkle the reserved almonds on top.bake and use crackers to serve.enjoy
78d578c5e4.pred:
To make Sunshine's Spicy and Tangy Lobster Dip, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the lobster classic, green onion, green bell pepper, celery, cream cheese, mayonnaise, milk, lemon juice, crushed red pepper, and black pepper to taste. Mix well to combine all ingredients.

2. If the dip is too thick, you can add a bit more milk to achieve the desired consistency.

3. Once the dip is well combined, transfer it to a serving bowl and gently stir in the sliced almonds (crushed) for added texture and flavor.

4. Serve the dip immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving. This will allow the flavors to meld together and enhance the overall taste.

Enjoy your delicious and tangy lobster dip!

38b480c606.gt:
Make the cake mix as directed
Make cookie mix as directed
Pour some cake mix in cake pan.
About an inch
Place as many cooked cookies as you can in the middle
Pour remaining cake mix and bake as directed
Eat and be Fat & Happy
38b480c606.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Strawberry Cake mix, Triple Chocolate Cookie mix, and the Purple Icing with sprinkles.
4. Mix the ingredients until well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the cake is fully cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into equal portions.

Enjoy your delicious Strawberry/ Triple Chocolate Cookie Cake!

f15f7c9832.gt:
Cut the chicken into thin diagonal slices, then into 1 cm strips.
Finely julienne the peppers.
Rub the shio-koji into the chicken.
Add the ingredients and rub to flavor the chicken.
Heat oil in a frying pan.
Spread the chicken and cook over high heat until the edges turn white.
Flip over, and brown both sides.
Add the peppers and shio-konbu and stir fry quickly.
Swirl in the sake and it's done!
f15f7c9832.pred:
1. Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized pieces.
2. In a small bowl, mix the shio-kombu and sake until the shio-kombu is fully submerged. Allow the mixture to sit for at least 30 minutes.
3. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
4. Add the chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until they are browned on all sides.
5. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the green peppers and cook until they are tender.
7. Add the shio-kombu mixture to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Add the soy sauce, katakuriko, shio-koji, and sake to the skillet. Stir to combine.
9. Return the chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
10. Serve the With Shio-Koji! Tender and Flavorful Stir Fried Chicken Breast over rice or noodles.

[/INST]

57f1deb064.gt:
Heat oven to 400F.
In a large bowl, combine the mustard, vinegar, 2 tablespoons of the oil, the garlic, tarragon, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Add the chicken and toss to coat.
Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast until cooked through, about 45 minutes.
During the last 15 minutes of roasting, cook the noodles according to the package directions.
Drain and return to the pot.
Add the parsley and the remaining oil and toss to coat.
Transfer the chicken to individual plates.
Place the pan containing the drippings over medium-high heat.
Add the wine and cook, stirring and scraping the bits from the bottom of the pan, until the wine reduces slightly, about 5 minutes.
Divide the noodles among the plates and spoon the sauce over the top.
57f1deb064.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the Dijon mustard, cider vinegar, olive oil, garlic, and salt and pepper.
3. Add the chicken pieces to the bowl and toss to coat them evenly with the marinade. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours.
4. Meanwhile, cook the egg noodles according to the package instructions until they are al dente.
5. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chopped tarragon and cook for about 1 minute, or until fragrant.
6. Add the chicken pieces to the skillet and cook until they are browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
7. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
8. In the same skillet, add the wine and bring it to a simmer. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half, about 3-4 minutes.
9. Add the cooked egg noodles to the skillet and toss to combine with the sauce.
10. Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and toss to coat with the sauce.
11. Serve the chicken and egg noodles over a bed of fresh flat-leaf parsley.

Enjoy your delicious Mustard-Tarragon Roast Chicken With Egg Noodles dish!

0f717fcce7.gt:
Bring a pot of water to the boil, add the oranges, cover and simmer for one hour.
Stain off the water.
Cool the oranges.
If you are in a hurry, I suggest you partly cool them -- (this will still work).
While they are cooling, food process the sugar with the eggs until the sugar is dissolved and pour into a bowl.
Cut the oranges in half and de-seed them and put the oranges (with peel and pith) into a food processor and pulp until reasonably smooth.
Pour the pulp into the sugar/egg mix and add the almond meal.
Gently mix together.
Pour mix into baking paper lined 24 - 26cm springform tin and bake for 50 - 60 minutes at 185C.
Serve with creme fraiche, whipped cream, or vanilla ice-cream -- makes an awesome dessert.
You could drizzle a little citrus liqueur around the plate.
Added thoughts -- This cake DOES NOT need any syrup poured over it.
NB.Simply double this recipe to get two large cakes.
It is just as successful.
Occasionally, I will add a slurp of Grand Marnier, Contreau, or Galliano; however, try it plain initially.
0f717fcce7.pred:
[/INST]

1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 3 large oranges, 500 g white sugar, and 6 large eggs.
3. Add the 500 g almond meal to the bowl and mix until well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into a well-greased and floured cake pan.
5. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for about 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
7. Once cooled, use a sharp knife to slice the cake into equal portions.

Enjoy your delicious Orange Almond Cake!

62bf8025cc.gt:
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat.
Add the onion and saute for three minutes, then add the garlic.
Continue cooking until the onions are soft, 1-2 minutes more.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Add the jalapenos and carrots and cook for 5 minutes, until slightly softened.
Add the cider vinegar, 1 tbsp pickling salt, oregano and bay leaves and simmer for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.
Transfer the jalapenos, carrots and onions with slotted spoon or tongs into sterilized glass quart-sized jars.
Throw away the bay leaves.
Cover the vegetables with the cooking liquid until the jars are three-quarters full.
Add 1 tbsp pickling salt to each jar and fill to the top with white vinegar.
Cap each jar tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to several months.
The pickled vegetables can be used starting one week later.
62bf8025cc.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook until the onion is translucent, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the carrot, jalapeno chiles, and cider vinegar to the pan.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the carrots are tender.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool slightly.
6. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a large bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
7. Stir in the pickling salt, oregano, and bay leaves.
8. Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature.
9. Pour the mixture into a clean glass jar, leaving 1/2 inch of space at the top.
10. Store the jar in a cool, dark place for at least 2 weeks before using.

[/INST]

1. To serve, pour the pickled mixture over the sliced carrots in a large bowl, and garnish with thinly sliced jalapeno chiles and fresh cilantro.
2. Serve the Escabeche De Mexicana as a side dish or a topping for tacos, tortas, or other Mexican-inspired dishes.

[/SYS]

3af2ae11f5.gt:
Combine salt, pepper, chili powder and bay leaves.
Rub meat completely with liquid Smoke.
Place meat, fat side up, in a large roasting pan.
Sprinkle dry seasoning mixture on top.
Cover tightly.
Bake for 3 1/2 to 4 hours at 325 degrees.
Scrape seasoning off meat and cut in very thin slices across the grain.
Serve with barbecue sauce.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with sliced brisket.
3af2ae11f5.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Season the beef brisket with salt, pepper, chili powder, and crushed bay leaf.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the liquid smoke, brown sugar, catsup, water, Worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, celery seeds, and cayenne pepper.
4. Place the beef brisket in a large roasting pan, and pour the marinade over it.
5. Cover the roasting pan with aluminum foil, and bake the brisket in the preheated oven for 4-5 hours, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 190°F (88°C).
6. Remove the brisket from the oven, and let it rest for 15-20 minutes before slicing it thinly.
7. Serve the sliced brisket with the barbecue sauce on the side for dipping.

[/INST]

db5fd3bd93.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the bacon until almost cooked, but not too crisp.
Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place it in a large bowl.
Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease from the skillet and discard it or use it for another purpose.
Add the onion and green pepper into the skillet, if using.
Saute for a few minutes to soften.
Add them into the large bowl with the bacon.
Into the large bowl add the undrained pork and beans, the 2 cans of rinsed and drained beans and the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Cover the dish with a sheet of foil and bake at 325 F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking for 20-25 more minutes.
Cooks Notes: Sometime I will add a chipotle chile with a little of the adobo sauce that has been finely diced.
You know I cant get enough of those!
It is also delicious to turn them into cowboy beans (what Nanny called them) and add cooked ground beef or sausage.
db5fd3bd93.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or saucepan, cook the bacon over medium heat until it is crispy. Remove the bacon from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, cook the onion and green pepper over medium heat until they are tender.
4. Add the pork and beans, barbecue sauce, ketchup, picante sauce, molasses, maple syrup, brown sugar, liquid smoke, dry mustard, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder to the pan. Stir to combine.
5. Pour the mixture into a large baking dish or casserole dish.
6. Add the crispy bacon on top of the beans.
7. Bake the beans in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until the beans are tender and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
8. Serve the Bold and Saucy Baked Beans hot, garnished with fresh chopped parsley if desired.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

85b79cc54f.gt:
In a large skillet over medium heat, add meatless ground burger, water and spices.
Mix well and let simmer for 10-15 minutes until heated through and water is absorbed.
Use this mixture to replace the seasoned ground beef in any of your favorite Mexican recipes!
Another note* One can use 1 cup of TVP in place of the soy crumbles or Boca.
You might need a bit more that 1 cup of water to keep mixture from getting too dry.
85b79cc54f.pred:
1. In a small bowl, mix the instant minced onion, chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, and oregano.
2. In a large saucepan, combine the water, vegetable bouillon cube, and spice mixture.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the vegetarian ground beef to the saucepan, stirring to combine.
5. Cook the "meat" for about 5-7 minutes, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.
6. Remove the "meat" from the saucepan and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the cooked "meat" in your favorite taco shells, garnished with your favorite toppings.

This recipe creates a delicious and satisfying Vegetarian Taco "meat" that can be enjoyed by those who prefer a plant-based alternative to traditional meat-based taco fillings.

1432c540ac.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk the canola oil, vinegar, miso, ginger, sesame oil, honey, lime zest, and lime juice until smooth.
Season with salt.
On a rimmed baking sheet, toss the tomatoes with 3 tablespoons of the miso dressing and season with salt.
Roast for 20 minutes, stirring, until the tomatoes are charred in spots.
Scrape into a large bowl.
Cook the soba noodles in boiling water just until al dente, 4 minutes.
Drain and cool the noodles under cold running water.
Add the soba noodles, scallions, and half of the remaining dressing to the tomatoes and toss well.
Season with salt, transfer to a platter, and garnish with the sesame seeds.
Serve with the remaining dressing.Looking for vegetable recipes?
Try our best asparagus recipes, eggplant recipes, or zucchini recipes.
1432c540ac.pred:
1. In a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
2. Add the minced ginger and toasted sesame oil, and cook for 1 minute.
3. Add the unseasoned rice vinegar, light yellow miso, and honey, and stir to combine.
4. Cook the mixture for 1-2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
5. Add the lime zest, lime juice, and kosher salt, and stir to combine.
6. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until they are heated through.
7. Add the soba noodles to the skillet, and stir to combine.
8. Cook the noodles until they are heated through and slightly coated with the sauce.
9. Add the scallions and toasted sesame seeds, and stir to combine.
10. Serve the Soba Noodles with Miso-Roasted Tomatoes immediately.

[/SYS]

44b3907e95.gt:
Combine all the cupcake ingredients in a bowl and mix until smooth.
If you want them to be more pink, add a bit of red food coloring.
Fill lined cupcake tin 2/3 of the way full.
Bake cupcakes at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.
Combine Frosting ingredients and beat until smooth.
When cupcakes are cooled, topped with frosting.
Top them off with a maraschino cherry.
44b3907e95.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, alternating with the maraschino cherry juice, and mix until just combined.
6. If desired, fold in the chocolate chips.
7. Fill the cupcake liners with the batter, filling them about 3/4 full.
8. Bake the cupcakes for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cupcakes to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once the cupcakes are cooled, you can decorate them with maraschino cherries and a dusting of powdered sugar, if desired.

[/INST]

72d89ed4de.gt:
Place all of the ingredients in a medium bowl; stir until they are combined, and transfer to an airtight container for storage.
Season popcorn to taste.
72d89ed4de.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper (if using), chili powder, cumin, parmesan cheese, oregano, and red pepper flakes (if using).
3. Mix the ingredients thoroughly until well combined.
4. Spread the seasoning mixture evenly on a baking sheet or a lined baking sheet.
5. Roast the seasoning mixture in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until it reaches your desired level of crispiness.
6. Allow the seasoning mixture to cool completely before using it to season popcorn.
7. To make popcorn, fill a large pot with oil and heat it over medium heat.
8. When the oil is hot, add the popcorn kernels and cover the pot.
9. Shake the pot gently to ensure even cooking and to prevent the popcorn from sticking to the bottom.
10. As the popcorn pops, use a slotted spoon or a spider to transfer it to a large bowl.
11. Season the popcorn with the roasted seasoning mixture, tossing it gently to ensure even coverage.
12. Serve the seasoned popcorn immediately or store it in an airtight container for later enjoyment.

[/INST]

856a830dc7.gt:
Soak cucumber in cold salted (1 tsp) water for 5 minutes.
Drain and squeeze well.
Bring the water to a boil, add beanstarch vermicelli and cook according to the directions on the package.
Cut into bite sized pieces.
Mix all ingredients and marinate.
856a830dc7.pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients: Wash the cucumber and slice it thinly.
2. Prepare the marinade: Mix the marinade ingredients in a small bowl.
3. Cook the vermicelli according to the package instructions.
4. In a separate bowl, toss the sliced cucumber in the marinade.
5. When the vermicelli is cooked, drain it and rinse it with cold water to stop the cooking process.
6. Combine the cooked vermicelli with the marinated cucumber in a large bowl.
7. Add the marinade to the bowl and toss everything together until the vermicelli is evenly coated with the marinade.
8. Serve the dish immediately or refrigerate it for later.

[/INST]

6cd8583372.gt:
Simmer all ingredients in covered saucepan over low heat 20 minutes.
Strain out solids before serving.
6cd8583372.pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the apple cider, quince, brown sugar, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 15-20 minutes, or until the quince is tender.
2. Remove the cinnamon stick and cloves from the pot. Stir in the ground nutmeg.
3. Serve the warm, spiked apple cider immediately, or let it cool and refrigerate for a refreshing, chilled beverage.

c7ae046d51.gt:
Place buttermilk, butter or margarine, sugar, salt, flour, whole wheat flour, and yeast into pan of bread machine.
Bake on White Bread setting.
Cool on wire racks before slicing.
c7ae046d51.pred:
To cook a delicious Buttermilk Bread I dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 1 1/2 cups buttermilk, 1 1/2 tablespoons margarine, 2 tablespoons white sugar, and 1 teaspoon salt. Whisk until the sugar is fully dissolved.

2. Add the 3 cups bread flour, 1 1/3 cups whole wheat flour, and 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast to the bowl. Mix the ingredients until they are well combined.

3. Gradually add the remaining 1/3 cup of whole wheat flour, and mix until the dough comes together. The dough should be slightly sticky but not too wet.

4. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface, and knead it until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.

5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth or plastic wrap, and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-1 1/2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.

6. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

7. Punch down the dough, and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Divide the dough into 8-10 equal portions, and shape each portion into a smooth ball.

8. Place the shaped dough balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

9. Allow the dough to rise for another 30-45 minutes, or until it has doubled in size.

10. Bake the dough balls in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown.

11. Remove the bread from the oven, and let it cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Enjoy your delicious Buttermilk Bread I dish!

3fcf600832.gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
In a small bowl, add balsamic vinegar, brown sugar and chicken broth; mix well, set aside.
Rinse pork and pat dry and season with salt and pepper.
In an oven proof skillet, add olive oil and pork.
Sear pork until all sides are seared and lightly brown, about 10 minutes.
Remove pork from pan.
In the same pan over medium low heat, add the balsamic vinegar mixture and stir to loosen up all the brown bits from bottom of pan.
Stir and cook until it resembles a glaze.
Place pork back in pan and turn to coat until all sides are covered with balsamic mixture.
Place in the oven and roast for 25 minutes or until pork is no longer pink.
When pork is done, remove from pan and cover for about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a skillet, add butter and pears and cook over medium low heat until pears are tender, about 10 minutes.
Just before you take the pears off the stove, add a splash of Stella Artois Cidre and mix well.
Cut pork into 4 equal sizes.
Place 1/2 cup of sweet mashed potatoes on each plate, place the pork over the sweet potatoes, and lay pears over pork.
Sprinkle with goat cheese.
3fcf600832.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the pork tenderloin with salt and pepper.
3. Heat the olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pork tenderloin and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the diced pears and cook until they are tender, about 3-5 minutes.
6. Add the sweet potatoes to the skillet and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the chicken broth, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, and low-sodium chicken broth. Stir to combine.
8. Return the pork tenderloin to the skillet and cook for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through.
9. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve the pork tenderloin with sauteed pears and sweet potatoes on a plate, garnished with goat cheese crumbles.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful Pork Tenderloin with Sauteed Pears and Sweet Potatoes!

16241b3374.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and move a rack to the middle of the oven.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
Combine the peanut butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla extract and egg in a large bowl and stir until fully combined.
Form 24 balls, 1-inch in diameter, and set evenly spaced apart on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until lightly browned and crisp on the edges, 15 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the oven, and cool for 5 minutes.
Use your thumb or the back of a spoon to press into the middle of each cookie to create an indent about 1/4-inch deep.
Spoon 1/2 teaspoon of the chocolate-hazelnut spread into each cookie indent, refrigerate until the chocolate-hazelnut filling is no longer runny, 10 to 15 minutes.
Cook's Notes: These tasty cookies last for up to 2 weeks.
16241b3374.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream together the peanut butter, light brown sugar, and granulated sugar until smooth.
3. Add the egg and vanilla extract, and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, and salt.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/4 inch (0.6 cm).
7. Using a cookie cutter or the bottom of a glass, cut out the dough into desired shapes.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
9. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set but still slightly soft in the center.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious Chocolate-Peanut Butter Thumbprint Cookies!

2af4ecd0e3.gt:
Mix butter, margarine, flour, sugar, vanilla together.
Keep dough in refrigerator overnight.
After the dough has refrigerated overnight, take it out of the fridge, and start making small balls (a little smaller than a golf ball I use a Tablespoon full) out of the dough.
After you make your balls, roll each one out into a flat disc, and add hoop cheese and nuts and a Tablespoon of preserves (or more if youd like) into the center of the disc.
Then roll the discs up.
Seal edges by pinching them together (you can add a little water too, if you need some adhesive) and bake at 350 degrees F until golden brown (roughly 8 10 minutes).
*Hoop cheese is also known as farmers cheese.
2af4ecd0e3.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and margarine until smooth.
3. Gradually add the flour, sugar, and vanilla, mixing until well combined.
4. Add the shredded hoop cheese and ground walnuts, mixing until the dough comes together.
5. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and shape it into a ball.
6. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
7. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

These instructions should provide a clear guide for preparing and cooking Grandma Thomsons Thrutkies, ensuring that they are delicious and well-prepared.

b5234384e0.gt:
Heat oven to 325
Sautee onion and celery
Cook noodles as directed.
Mix tuna with mayo and soup.
Once noodles are cooked mix into tuna and mayo mix.
Spoon into casserole dish.
Sprinkle crumbled potato chips on top.
Bake for 30 mins or until potato chips are browned.
b5234384e0.pred:
[INST]
To prepare Tuna Noodle Casserole, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the tuna, Cream of mushroom soup, and mayonnaise. Mix well.
3. Add the shell noodles to the bowl and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the crushed potato chips with a small amount of melted butter.
5. Spread the potato chip mixture evenly over the top of the noodle mixture.

7. Serve the Tuna Noodle Casserole immediately.

[/INST]

587189f28c.gt:
Okay.. so, not everyone is going to be extremely lucky like we were and have their friends spend over 12 hours smoking a pork shoulder with pineapple injection and giving you a Tupperware full to go home with...
But if you are or you know how to smoke your own.. this recipe is super exciting.
Spread out some delicious, crunchy tortilla chips, (I used Calidad brand) on a small baking sheet and cover with shredded cheese of your choice,( again, I used marble cheddar), be thorough, every hates a cheeseless chip.
Put in oven on 350 for about 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Take chips out of the oven and sprinkle with sliced black olives
Add a moderate layer of refried beans and another layer of cheese and stick back in the oven for 2 minutes
Sprinkle with Tapatio(or your favorite hot sauce
Spread a layer of your shredded meat and another layer of cheese.
Place back in oven for two more minutes.
Get out your salsa, sour cream and guacamole!
I just sliced up an avocado :P. Its time to eat!
587189f28c.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread the tortilla chips out on a baking sheet or a large plate.
3. In a large bowl, combine the shredded meat, shredded cheese, sliced olives, and Tapatio hot sauce. Mix well.
4. Spread the meat mixture evenly over the tortilla chips.
5. Bake the nachos in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the nachos from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the Smoked Shredded Pork Shoulder Macho Nachos immediately. Enjoy!

bf7afbd2d2.gt:
In a large mixing bowl combine lettuce, carrots, cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
Lay out tortillas and divide mixture among tortillas; top with turkey breast strips.
Fold in half and enjoy.
Serves 2.
bf7afbd2d2.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the turkey breast slices with salt and pepper.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
4. Add the turkey breast slices to the skillet and cook until they are browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
5. Remove the turkey from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the shredded lettuce and cook until wilted, about 2-3 minutes.
7. Add the carrots to the skillet and cook until they are tender, about 3-4 minutes.
8. In a small bowl, mix the lime juice, cilantro, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
9. Add the turkey breast slices to the skillet and toss them in the lime mixture.
10. Place the tortillas on a flat surface and spoon a small amount of the turkey and vegetable mixture onto each tortilla.
11. Fold the tortilla over the filling and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious Soft Turkey Tacos!

48d0d21f53.gt:
Stir in a mixing glass with ice.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
48d0d21f53.pred:
1. In a mixing glass, combine the Rye Whiskey, Punt Y Mes, and Maraschino Liqueur.
2. Fill the mixing glass with ice.
3. Stir the ingredients until well-chilled and the ice is almost melted.
4. Strain the mixture into a cocktail glass.
5. Garnish with a cherry and a lemon twist.

These are the steps to make a Red Hook Cocktail using the ingredients provided. The Red Hook Cocktail is a classic cocktail that combines Rye Whiskey, Punt Y Mes, and Maraschino Liqueur to create a smooth and delicious drink.

d99c985b0e.gt:
Combine all ingredients.
except the sesame seeds.
Cover and refrigerate mixture for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add sesame seeds.
(If desired).
mix well.
Serve over salad.
d99c985b0e.pred:
Fancy Lady Salad Dressing:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together the vegetable oil, white wine vinegar, sesame oil, lemon juice, seasoned pepper, sugar, and garlic powder.
2. Slowly drizzle in the sesame seeds, whisking continuously to ensure a smooth and even consistency.
3. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
4. Serve the dressing over a bed of mixed greens, and enjoy your Fancy Lady Salad.

[/INST]

8a45727c6f.gt:
Remove stems from mushrooms.
Make a light mushroom broth by simmering stems in 2 cups water for 15 minutes, then strain and reserve broth (discard stems).
Dice mushroom caps and set aside.
Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes.
Cover with boiling salted water, let steep for 15 minutes, then drain.
Put oil in a wok or wide skillet over medium heat.
Add red peppers, black beans and bean paste and cook, stirring until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add garlic and ginger and let sizzle, then add mushrooms, soy sauce, sesame oil and Sichuan pepper.
Add 1 1/2 cups mushroom broth and cook mixture gently for 2 minutes.
Carefully add tofu cubes.
Shake pan to distribute sauce, using a wooden spoon to help.
Try to avoid smashing tofu.
Drizzle in cornstarch mixture, gently swirling pan to incorporate (sauce will thicken) and simmer tofu in sauce for 2 minutes more.
Thin with a little mushroom broth if necessary.
Transfer to a low bowl or platter.
Sprinkle with scallions and cilantro sprigs.
8a45727c6f.pred:
[INST]To prepare Vegetarian Mapo Tofu, follow these steps:
1. In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with the cold water until smooth. Set aside.
2. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and ginger, stirring constantly for 1-2 minutes.
3. Add the shiitake mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned.
4. Add the tofu to the skillet, breaking it into bite-sized pieces. Cook until the tofu is golden brown and slightly crispy on the outside.
5. Add the fermented black beans, fermented spicy broad bean paste, soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, Sichuan pepper, and cornstarch mixture to the skillet. Stir to combine.
6. Cook for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens slightly.
7. Add the water, scallions, and cilantro sprigs to the skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the scallions are tender.
8. Serve the Vegetarian Mapo Tofu over rice or noodles, garnished with the remaining cilantro sprigs.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

dfa22ec3cd.gt:
Combine (sift, if possible) the whole wheat flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
Add the olive oil to the dry ingredients and mix until crumbly.
Add the milk a little at a time, kneading until it forms a dough.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, then chill in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes.
If you're in a hurry, you can skip this step.
Dust your working surface with flour, then knead the dough, just a little bit.
Do not knead too much.
Evenly spread out the dough, then cut into desired shapes.
I use a cup to cut them into circles!
Then all you need to do is bake them for 20 minutes in an oven preheated to 170C.
Keep an eye on the oven and adjust the baking time.
They're done!
If they don't taste sweet enough, serve them with maple syrup or your choice of sweetener.
Have them for breakfast.
I found them delightful.
dfa22ec3cd.pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
3. Add the olive oil and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Gradually add the milk, stirring until the dough comes together.
5. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Pat the dough into a 1-inch thickness and cut into desired shapes using a scone cutter or a sharp knife.
7. Place the scones on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the scones for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
9. Remove the scones from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

bd3bd0a131.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, cream together margarine, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs and vanilla.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add to egg mixture, and mix well.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Instead of just dropping them onto the cookie sheet, I roll the cookies into balls - it makes them all look very uniform and nice!
Bake in preheated oven for 12 to15 minutes, or until light brown.
Cool on a wire rack.
bd3bd0a131.pred:
[/INSTRUCT]

[INSTRUCT]
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream the margarine and white sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the vanilla extract and eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and salt, mixing until a soft dough forms.
5. Fold in the chocolate chips.
6. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the centers are set.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INSTRUCT]

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

9b3acc9089.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with two long sheets of Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil, overlapping them in opposing directions so you make a cross, with plenty of foil at each end to eventually fold over into the center.
Lightly spray with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, stir together cream, shallot and garlic.
Add parsnips, sweet potato and turnip and carefully toss together until all the pieces are well coated.
In another mixing bowl combine 1 cup of cheese, green onion and thyme and toss together.
To assemble, place a single layer of cream-coated root vegetable pieces onto the foil-lined baking sheet and season generously with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle 1/4 of the cheese mixture over the surface.
Repeat with another layer of vegetables, salt and pepper and cheese mixture and continue with this pattern until all the ingredients have been used (finishing with a layer of vegetables).
Bring each side of the excess foil hanging over the baking sheet together and seal tightly, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
Bake gratin in the oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender.
Open foil carefully by cutting along top fold with a sharp knife, allowing steam to escape; then open top of foil.
Uncover gratin and sprinkle remaining cheese over the top.
Place gratin under a broiler and broil for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until cheese has melted and the top has browned slightly.
Allow gratin to cool for about 10 minutes before cutting up and serving.
9b3acc9089.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the heavy cream over medium heat. Add the shallot and garlic, and cook until the shallot is softened and translucent.
3. Add the sweet potato, parsnips, and turnip to the skillet, and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the shredded Gruyere cheese to the skillet, and stir until the cheese is melted and the vegetables are coated evenly. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a large baking dish, spreading it evenly.
6. Roll out the Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil to a large sheet, and place it over the vegetable mixture.
7. Fold the foil over the vegetables, creating a tight seal.
8. Bake the foil-wrapped vegetables in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
9. Remove the foil from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before carefully opening the foil and serving the Root Vegetable Gratin.

[/INST]

32d7fb7310.gt:
To roast vegetables: Preheat oven to 400.
Wrap peeled garlic cloves together in foil with a few drops of olive oil and put in oven for the same time you will be roasting the peppers and potatoes, around 35 minutes.
Cut potatoes in half and cut red peppers into half inch pieces.
In a large bowl, toss potatoes, bell peppers and 3 TBS olive oil, along with salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange potatoes and bell peppers in one layer, divided amongst 2 shallow baking pans.
Roast in the middle and lower third of the oven, switching positions of the pans halfway through the roasting time, for a total of 35 minutes, or until potatoes are golden brown and tender.
To make salad: After potatoes are done,remove pans from oven and immediately toss roasted potatoes and peppers with 2 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Cool and remove garlic from foil.
Squeeze cloves into a small bowl and mash with a fork with remaining 1/2 TBS olive oil and 1 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Toss together with potatoes and peppers.
Just before serving, add fresh basil.
Serve at room temperature.
Optional items you could add for a main dish meal: goat cheese, toasted pine nuts, grilled chicken, grilled tuna, etc.
32d7fb7310.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Place the garlic cloves on a baking sheet and roast them in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until they are golden brown and fragrant.
3. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the potatoes and cook them until they are tender but not mushy, about 15-20 minutes. Drain the potatoes and let them cool.
4. In a large bowl, combine the cooked potatoes, red bell peppers, and roasted garlic cloves.
5. In a small bowl, whisk together 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Pour the dressing over the potato mixture and toss to coat evenly.
7. Add the fresh basil leaves and toss again.
8. Serve the Roasted Potato Salad immediately or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

827de473ae.gt:
Position oven rack to center position.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Butter a 10-inch pie plate.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir bacon in the hot skillet until crisp, 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove bacon and drain all but 2 tablespoons grease from skillet.
Cook and stir asparagus and mushrooms in the remaining bacon grease until asparagus is tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove skillet from heat and toss bacon into asparagus mixture.
Spread asparagus-bacon mixture into the prepared pie pan.
Sprinkle Swiss cheese over mixture.
Whisk cream, eggs, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Pour egg mixture over asparagus-cheese mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until quiche is set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
827de473ae.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy whipping cream, salt, and pepper.
3. Add the diced bacon, asparagus, and sliced mushrooms to the bowl. Stir to combine.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9-inch (23cm) quiche dish.
5. Bake the quiche in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
6. Remove the quiche from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

bf91ac4066.gt:
Saute onion in vegetable oil until clear.
Add all other ingredients and simmer for 10mins
Puree with hand mixer until smooth
bf91ac4066.pred:
To cook a delightful Marion-berry BBQ Sauce dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan, combine 2/3 of a quart of ketchup, 1/3 of a quart of beer, and 2/3 cup of Worcestershire sauce.
2. Add 1 cup of minced yellow onion, 1/3 cup of lime juice, 1/8 cup of malt vinegar, 1 tbsp of kosher salt, 1 each of chipotle pepper in adobe sauce, 1 cup of brown sugar, 1 each of bay leaf, 1/8 cup of yellow mustard, 1 tbsp of liquid smoke, 1/2 tbsp of Creole spice, and 1 1/3 tbsp of molasses.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and let it cook for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. After 30 minutes, add 1 1/2 cups of Marion berries and continue to cook for another 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Once the sauce has thickened and the Marion berries are tender, remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Strain the sauce through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any solids and discard the solids.
7. Serve the Marion-berry BBQ Sauce over your choice of meat, such as chicken, pork, or beef, for a delicious and unique BBQ experience.

[/INST]

97ad761304.gt:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees.
Grease a springform pan; dust with cocoa.
Line bottom with kitchen parchment.
In 2 qt saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate with butter.
In large bowl, with wire whisk beat egg yolks and vanilla.
Slowly beat warm chocolate mixture into yolk mixture until blended.
In small bowl with mixer at high speed, beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
Gradually beat in 1/4 cup powdered sugar until sugar dissolves and whites stand in stiff peaks.
Fold beaten egg whites into chocolate mixture, one third at a time.
Spoon batter into pan spreading evenly.
Bake torte 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out almost clean.
Cool torte in pan.
When torte is cool, remove side of pan then remove torte from pan bottom; discard parchment.
Cut torte in 12 wedges.
Sprinkle 6 wedges with cocoa, remaining 6 wedges with confectioners sugar.
Arrange wedges alternately on cake plate.
97ad761304.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped chocolate, butter, and vanilla.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and then gradually add them to the chocolate mixture, stirring gently to combine.
4. Gradually add the confectioners' sugar, stirring until smooth.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once cooled, dust the top of the cake with powdered sugar, if desired.

[/INST]

This step-by-step guide provides a clear and concise recipe for making a delicious Chocolate Torte using the provided ingredients. The instructions are easy to follow, and the result should be a rich, moist, and flavorful dessert.

887374647e.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly grease one 9x13 inch pan.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, flour, baking soda, vanilla, butter or margarine, honey and brown sugar.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Lightly press mixture into the prepared pan.
Bake at 325 degrees F for 18 to 22 minutes or until golden brown.
Let cool for 10 minutes then cut into bars.
Let bars cool completely in pan before removing or serving.
887374647e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, flour, baking soda, and vanilla.
3. In a separate bowl, melt the butter and honey together.
4. Add the melted butter and honey mixture to the dry ingredients, stirring until well combined.
5. Fold in the mini chocolate chips.
6. Press the mixture evenly into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
8. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Cut the bars into desired sizes and let them cool completely before storing.

Enjoy your homemade Chewy Granola Bars!

d939f3ae1c.gt:
Use cooking spray and heat garlic and ginger over medium-high heat till golden brown.
Stir in tomato sauce, coriander, cumin, pepper, masala, salt, and reduce heat to low.
Partially cover and summer for 8-9 minutes stirring frequently.
Stir in spinach.
Simmer 8-10 minutes until spinach turns olive green.
Stir in whipping cream.
Stir in cheese.
Simmer for 3-4 minutes or until cheese is hot and remove from stove.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and ginger, cooking for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
3. Add the thawed spinach and cook until it has wilted, about 3-4 minutes.
4. Add the cubed panir (if using) and cook until it is heated through.
5. In a small bowl, mix the low-fat whipping cream, garam masala, coriander, cumin, red cayenne pepper, and salt.

9. Serve the Indian Saag Paneer over rice or with your favorite side dish.

fc1f93e1ef.gt:
Preheat oven to 325F.
Crumble the ginger snaps in a food processor and add the melted butter.
Use this mixture to line a deep pie plate or spring form pan.
Bake this at 325F for 19 minutes.
Beat the egg yolks well, and add the sugar.
Soak the gelatin in the cold water and heat gently over low flame until fully dissolved.
Pour over sugar and egg mixture, stirring briskly.
Whip the cream until stiff.
Fold in the egg mixture and flavor with the rum.
Cool in the refrigerator until mixture begins to set and pour into the pie shell.
Chill until firm and garnish with chocolate curls and chopped nuts.
fc1f93e1ef.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, sugar, and gelatin.
3. In a saucepan, heat the melted butter over medium heat until it reaches 110°F (43°C).
4. Carefully pour the hot butter into the egg mixture, whisking constantly to combine.
5. Pour the mixture back into the saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches 160°F (71°C).
6. Remove the mixture from the heat and stir in the dark rum.
7. Pour the mixture into a pie crust, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until set.
8. Chill the pie in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight.
9. Before serving, garnish the pie with chocolate curls and chopped nuts.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

0d6724156e.gt:
Slice tofu in half lengthwise, then cut each half into two long strips, approximately 1/2-inch thick.
Mix remaining ingredients in a small bowl.
Lay tofu strips in a shallow pan and pour marinade over, turning tofu to coat.
Marinade for at least 1 hour, or as long as overnight.
Heat oil in grill or nonstick pan over high heat.
Sear tofu on each side until browned and heated through, approximately 2-3 minutes per side.
0d6724156e.pred:
1. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a small bowl, mix together the extra firm tofu, peanut oil, sweet chili sauce, scallions, chopped cilantro, sliced jalapeno (optional), and kosher salt.
3. Allow the marinade to sit for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. While the marinade is sitting, prepare the grill by brushing it with a little oil to prevent sticking.
5. Once the grill is preheated, place the tofu mixture onto a grill pan or directly onto the grill. Cook the tofu for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until it reaches your desired level of doneness.
6. While the tofu is cooking, you can prepare the additional toppings, such as sliced avocado, sliced red onion, and a dollop of sour cream or yogurt.
7. Once the tofu is cooked, remove it from the grill and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into desired portions.
8. Serve the grilled tofu with the additional toppings and enjoy your delicious Grilled Tofu With Chili Lime Marinade.

133d9c352d.gt:
If berries are frozen, slightly thaw.
In a bowl, stir together sugar and flour.
Add fruit to sugar mixture, tosing well and spread mixture into baking dish.
Preheat oven to 375.
Topping:
Coarsely chop pistachios.
In a bowl, mix the flour and sugars.
Cut the butter into cubes with your fingers or a pastry blender, blending the flour mixture until it resembles coarse meal.
Add pistachios and toss well.
Squeeze a handful of topping together and coarsely crumble in chunks over filling.
Squeeze and evenly crumble remaining topping over filling in same manner.
Bake crisp in oven until filling is bubbling and topping is crisp and golden, about 50 minutes.
(can be done in advance).
Just before serving, heat crisp in 300 oven for 20 - 30 minutes until just warm.
Serve with ice cream or frozen yogurt.
Note: When measuring out the fruit.
I just add the blueberries and enough rhubarb to the baking dish, taking in to allowance the shrinkage of cooking.
If no rhubarb is available, just use all blueberries.
133d9c352d.pred:
[INST]
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the sugar, flour, and chopped pistachios.
3. Add the rhubarb and blueberries to the bowl, and mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, cream the butter and brown sugar until smooth.
5. Add the egg and vanilla extract to the butter mixture, and mix until well combined.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
7. Spread the dough evenly over a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake the crisp for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the fruit is bubbly and tender.
9. Allow the crisp to cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

73d512de54.gt:
Split eggplants in half and scoop out flesh, leaving 1/4 inch thick sides.
Drop flesh in boiling water for 5 minutes, remove, drain in colander.
Repeat with shells, remove and drain, set aside.
Cook onion, garlic, green pepper and celery in half of the butter until tender.
Add eggplant flesh, parsley, thyme, shrimp, salt and pepper, worcestershire and cayenne.
Add eggs to above, cook 5 minutes.
Fill shells with mixture, sprinkle with bread crumbs and bake 20-30 minutes at 350 degrees.
Melt remaining butter, pour over eggplants, sprinkle with parmesan cheese, serve hot.
73d512de54.pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare Shrimp Stuffed Eggplant (Aubergine), follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. Cut the eggplant in half lengthwise, and then cut each half into 4 equal pieces.
3. In a large bowl, mix together the bread crumbs, parsley, thyme, and seasoned bread crumbs.

8. Serve the Shrimp Stuffed Eggplant (Aubergine) as a main course or appetizer.

[/INST]

3d390b8cc2.gt:
Heat 1 T oil in a large soup pot over medium high heat.
Add sausage, and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until browned on all sides.
Transfer sausages to a plate.
Add remaining oil to drippings in pot to equal 1/4 C cup.
Whisk in flour Cook over low heat, stirring frequently for about 20 minutes or until mixture is dark reddish-brown.
Stir in onion, peppers, celery and garlic and saute over medium heat for 8 minutes or until softened.
Stir in stock and next 9 ingredients .
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, covered for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile cook grits according to package directions and and cheese.
Cover and keep warm.
Stir in sausage, shrimp, and crab sections and cook for about 3-4 minutes or until shrimp are just done.
Do not overcook.
Remove bay leaves and serve gumbo over cheese grits.
Season with hot sauce if desired.
3d390b8cc2.pred:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
2. Add the sliced andouille sausages and cook until browned, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the chopped onion, red bell pepper, green bell pepper, celery, and minced garlic to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally.
4. Pour in the fish stock or chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Add the diced tomatoes, undrained, and the sliced okra. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
6. Add the fresh thyme sprigs, bay leaves, kosher salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, file powder (if using), and fresh lime juice. Stir well.
7. Add the grits to the pot and stir to combine. Cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the grits are tender and creamy.
8. Add the shrimp and crab to the pot, stirring to combine. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the seafood is cooked through.
9. Taste and adjust the seasoning as needed.
10. Serve the Shrimp and Crab Gumbo over Cheese Grits hot, garnished with fresh parsley and hot sauce (if desired).

[/INST]

d8fd0d2fdf.gt:
Heat oven to 375F; Grease cookie sheets.
In large bowl, combine butter and cream cheese; beat until smooth; Add sweetened condensed milk and egg; blend well.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off; Add flour and brownie mix; mix well; (Reserve enclosed chocolate-flavored syrup packet for topping) Stir in pecans, coconut and chocolate chips; Drop dough by heaping tablespoonfuls 1 inch apart onto greased cookie sheets.
Bake at 375F for 9 to 12 minutes or until set; Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheets; Cool completely.
Cut very small hole in corner of reserved chocolate-flavored syrup packet; lightly drizzle over cooled cookies Store in tightly covered container.
d8fd0d2fdf.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter or margarine, cream cheese, and sweetened condensed milk. Mix until well combined.

4. Gradually add the all-purpose flour, mixing until a dough forms.
5. If the dough is too sticky, you can add a bit more flour. If it's too dry, you can add a bit more liquid.
6. Press the dough into a flat, even surface on a piece of parchment paper or a silicone mat.
